content: Sorry guys and gals, but I've got to vent. I live in an apartment. A few months ago, my neighbor above me was filling his tub with water. He got a phone call and sat in his livingroom talking while his tub overflowed and the water ended up in my kitchen. The maintenance guys had to tear out a portion of my ceiling and put in a new sheet of dryrock. Well....the moron just did it again. The water was flowing in through my kitchen ceiling. I was going to go up there and bang on his door but I had visions of me in a jail cell so thought it would be best to let the landlord handle it. He must have caugh it because the water has stopped. I did get another neighbor to come over to be a witness, plus I took photos. From what I understand, he did this a few years ago before I moved in. That makes it three times now. What a complete MORON! I called the apartment office and left a message as they are closed now. "Either he goes or I do!" Anyway....I feel a bit better now after venting. Don

What a complete MORON! I called the apartment office and left a message as they are closed now. "Either he goes or I do!" Anyway....I feel a bit better now after venting. Don
title: Better to vent here than go abuse my neighbor.

content: What's bad, all tubs have an overflow, and it shouldn't leak into your apt. I'ld be getting on management there too. They have some seals to fix upstairs. I know this because I was an apt mgr for a few years, and replaced plenty of those damn things. If you want payback to this guy, go turn off his electric meter on a regular basis. Or, go find his AC unit. There should be a fuse box nearby. Take the fuses.

Or, go find his AC unit. There should be a fuse box nearby. Take the fuses.

title: Better to vent here than go abuse my neighbor.

content: quote: Originally posted by 21yrsUSCGUSCS: Sorry guys and gals, but I've got to vent. I live in an apartment. A few months ago, my neighbor above me was filling his tub with water. He got a phone call and sat in his livingroom talking while his tub overflowed and the water ended up in my kitchen. The maintenance guys had to tear out a portion of my ceiling and put in a new sheet of dryrock. Well....the moron just did it again. The water was flowing in through my kitchen ceiling. I was going to go up there and bang on his door but I had visions of me in a jail cell so thought it would be best to let the landlord handle it. He must have caugh it because the water has stopped. I did get another neighbor to come over to be a witness, plus I took photos. From what I understand, he did this a few years ago before I moved in. That makes it three times now. What a complete MORON! I called the apartment office and left a message as they are closed now. "Either he goes or I do!" Anyway....I feel a bit better now after venting. Don Don, need me to send ya a Flash-bang? LOL
